note.p: Research Field: Experimental physics, scientific instrumentation
Education: Apprenticed as a draper to his elder brother (1678)
Career: Possibly assistant to Denis Papin (FRS 1680); Curator of experiments to the Royal Society (1703-1713); gave demonstrations at his house and hired James Hodgson (FRS 1703) to lecture for him
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; Clifton
References: Jessie M Sweet, 'Sir Hans Sloane's Metalline Cubes' in NR 1953 vol 10 pp 99-100
Henry Guerlac, 'Newton's Optical Aether: his Draft of a Proposed Addition to his Opticks' in NR 1967 vol 22 pp 45-57
Stephen F Mason, 'The Spring-Tide of Experimental Philosophy', review of Marie Boas Hall, Promoting Experimental Learning: Experiment and the Royal Society, 1660-1727 in NR 1992 vol 46 pp 313-316
P Fontes da Costa, 'The Culture of Curiosity at The Royal Society in the first half of the eighteenth century', NR 2002 vo l56 pp 147-166
Notes: Clifton says baptised 1660 at St Mary's Colchester. DSB gives burial date as 29 April 1713. See also MS 82 (letters of Brooke Taylor)
